Package com.cdd.lab3

Class ReusableBarrier

java.lang.Object
com.cdd.lab3.ReusableBarrier
public class ReusableBarrier extends Object
An instance of this ReusableBarrier can be shared between N threads and used to force threads to wait for all other threads to arrive at a rendezvous point in the code. After all threads signal they have arrived, the critical section of the code can be executed by all threads, then reset() can be used to determine when each thread has finished executing the critical section and reset the barrier to a state where it can be reused.

  • Field Details

    • mutex

      private final Semaphore mutex
      A semaphore used as a mutex lock to control access to the `count` variable.

    • turnstile1

      private static Semaphore turnstile1
      A semaphore used to make threads wait after they have reached the rendezvous point. When every thread has arrived, it is released allowing each thread to proceed.

    • turnstile2

      private static Semaphore turnstile2
      A semaphore used to make threads wait after they have finished executing their critical code. When the last thread arrives, it is released, allowing the barrier to be reset to it's initial state, so it will function in the next iteration of a loop.

    • numOfThreads

      private static int numOfThreads
      The number of threads that will use the barrier.

    • count

      private static int count
      Keeps track of the number of threads that have reached the rendezvous point.

  • Constructor Details

    • ReusableBarrier

      ReusableBarrier(int num)
      The constructor method.
      Parameters:
      num - the number of threads that will use the barrier.

  • Method Details

    • waitForAll

      public void waitForAll() throws InterruptedException
      This method is used to make each thread wait for the other threads after they have reached a rendezvous point. Once each thread signals that they have arrived all threads are allowed to continue.

      turnstile1 starts at 0, all threads will wait here until the last thread trips the conditional (count == numOfThreads). turnstile1 is then released, allowing all threads waiting at turnstile1.acquire() to proceed to turnstile1.release(), one by one.

      Throws:
      InterruptedException - in case any semaphore acquires fail.

    • reset

      public void reset() throws InterruptedException
      This method is used to reset the barrier after each thread has signalled it. Similar to waitForAll() threads will wait at turnstile2.acquire() until the conditional is tripped (count == 0 signalling that all threads have finished. All threads are released and the @{link ReusableBarrier} state is reset to a condition that allows it to be used in another iteration of a loop.
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - in case semaphore acquires fail.
